## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm interested in learning more about Verus's features for creating and managing decentralized tokens and blockchains. Can you walk me through what Verus offers and how these features enable users to create complex DeFi systems?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus provides a robust set of features that enable users to create and manage decentralized tokens and blockchains, as well as complex DeFi systems. Let me break it down for you.

Verus offers a range of features that enable users to create and manage decentralized tokens and blockchains, as well as complex DeFi systems. These features include:

**Multi-currency, user-created, decentralized tokens and blockchains:**
Verus allows any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain. This blockchain can send and receive from the Verus chain that launched it, and is 51% hash attack resistant. All PBaaS (Public Blockchain as a Service) chains run from the same daemon, and projects can choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon.

**Consensus-integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets:**
Any ID owner can define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100%. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This addresses the problems of miner-extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers.

**Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches:**
Verus enables the launch of a world-class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but are bound to the launch of the new blockchain and run on the new blockchain.

These features enable users to create complex DeFi systems with decentralized tokens and blockchains, as well as integrated liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets. This allows for a high degree of customization and flexibility, while also providing a robust and secure framework for building decentralized financial systems.

## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
 - Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
